title: How to Make a Glitter Tornado in a Bottle

steps.headline: Wear some rubber gloves.
steps.description: These are to protect your hands from the liquid substances during this experiment.

steps.headline: Place funnel on the empty bottle.
Slowly pour water into funnel, filling the bottle to the black fill line.
steps.description: Be careful to hold the bottom of the water bottle while pouring water into it to prevent it from tipping over.

steps.headline: Add a pinch of glitter into bottle of water.
steps.description: Choose any color as you please.

steps.headline: Add two squirts of liquid dish soap to the bottle of water.
steps.description: The squirts is pretty much leaning the dish soap bottle over to the water bottle, and squeezing twice.

steps.headline: Secure and tighten cap.
steps.description: Be sure cap it secured correctly, or water may spill or leak from cap.

steps.headline: Overturn bottle, and hold it upright.
steps.description: Rotate or stir bottle in a circular motion, at about medium speed for 5-10 seconds. It is crucial that you rotate/stir the bottle in a circular motion, because if you do side-to-side, it will just shake the water up. It has to be a good circle rotation.

steps.headline: Add food coloring.
steps.description: Re-open your bottle, and add one drop of food coloring to the water. Be sure to pick a light color so that you will be able to see the tornado,

steps.headline: Make another tornado.
steps.description: Be sure to tightly secure cap on water bottle. Overturn the bottle, and rotate the bottle in a circular motion, at about medium speed for 5-10 seconds.

steps.headline: Congratulations!
steps.description: You have successfully made an exciting glittered and colored tornado in a bottle!

Add a pinch of glitter into bottle of water. Choose any color as you please. Add two squirts of liquid dish soap to the bottle of water. The squirts is pretty much leaning the dish soap bottle over to the water bottle, and squeezing twice. Secure and tighten cap. Be sure cap it secured correctly, or water may spill or leak from cap. Overturn bottle, and hold it upright. Rotate or stir bottle in a circular motion, at about medium speed for 5-10 seconds. It is crucial that you rotate/stir the bottle in a circular motion, because if you do side-to-side, it will just shake the water up. It has to be a good circle rotation. Add food coloring. Re-open your bottle, and add one drop of food coloring to the water. Be sure to pick a light color so that you will be able to see the tornado, Make another tornado. Be sure to tightly secure cap on water bottle. Overturn the bottle, and rotate the bottle in a circular motion, at about medium speed for 5-10 seconds. Congratulations!
